newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: CBANK OKAYS INTERBANK FOREIGN CURRENCY CREDIT.
newsitem.headline: CBANK OKAYS INTERBANK FOREIGN CURRENCY CREDIT.

text.p: Lithuania's central bank said on Thursday that it has lifted restriction on commercial banks issuing interbank credits in foreign currency.
"Banks are allowed now to issue credits in foreign currency to other banks," the Bank of Lithuania said in a statement.
Commercial banks were restricted to issuing interbank credits in other currencies except the litas since 1993.
"We expect that this decision will give a positive impulse to the interbank credit market," Gitanas Nauseda, head of the cenral bank's policy department, told Reuters.
Nauseda also said that the central bank's aim is to end restrictions in areas which would not harm the stability of the banks and the litas.
